alert.note: Alert for St. Marys (Maryland) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Baltimore/Washington (Washington D.C., Central Maryland, Northern Virginia, Eastern West Virginia)
info.headline: Coastal Flood Advisory issued April 29 at 10:28AM EDT until April 30 at 8:00AM EDT by NWS Baltimore/Washington
info.description: ...COASTAL FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 AM EDT SUNDAY... * WHAT...Up to one half foot of inundation above ground level in low lying areas due to tidal flooding. * WHERE...Shoreline in St. Marys County. * WHEN...Until 8 AM EDT Sunday, especially around the time of high tide. * IMPACTS...At 3.0 feet, yards are flooded on Saint George Island, and water will begin covering the road leading to the island, especially if there is wave action. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Tides one and a half to two feet above normal. The next high tide at Coltons Point is at 11:04 AM and 11:49 PM. The next high tide at Point Lookout is at 10:01 PM and 10:27 AM. The next high tide at Piney Point is at 10:28 AM and 11:13 PM. Time of high total tides are approximate to the nearest hour. St Marys River at Straits Point MLLW Categories - Minor 3.0 ft, Moderate 3.5 ft, Major 5.0 ft MHHW Categories - Minor 1.4 ft, Moderate 1.9 ft, Major 3.4 ft Total Total Departure Day/Time Tide Tide from Norm Waves Flood ft MLLW ft MHHW ft ft Impact -------- --------- --------- --------- ------- -------- 29/10 AM 3.2 1.6 1.8 0.5 Minor 29/10 PM 3.1 1.5 1.7 1.0 Minor 30/11 AM 3.3 1.7 1.9 2.0 Minor 01/12 AM 3.0 1.4 1.5 1.0 Minor 01/11 AM 2.7 1.1 1.4 2.0 None 02/12 AM 2.7 1.1 1.2 1.0 None &&
info.instruction: If travel is required, allow extra time as some roads may be closed. Do not drive around barricades or through water of unknown depth. Take the necessary actions to protect flood-prone property.
